author: https://x.com/financedystop
text: A car mechanic explains he has to pay for a $10k scanner plus thousands in subscription fees and gets annoyed when people ask why he charges so much. https://t.co/8BYHF7KHCV

comments.text: @financedystop People get annoyed if you even charge them $1

@financedystop The gap just keeps getting wider betweeen what businesses charge versus consumers expectations.  (Specifically for jobs that don‚Äôt take long to do.)

And what consumers can afford.  A few thousand dollars can wipe someone out as a lot of people don‚Äôt have a big cash reserves
@financedystop Modern cars are computers on wheels. That scanner and those subscriptions aren‚Äôt optional ‚Äî they‚Äôre the cost of entry to even diagnose the problem.

@financedystop Doing brakes on a car with electronic parking brake system is easier using a scanner, but there are ways around it. That being said I don‚Äôt believe THAT scanner cost that much nor is the regular subscription cost that high.
@financedystop Changing brakes but still paying a subscription fee‚Äîthis is modern car ownership ü§¶

that is called professionalism.

@financedystop This is why I will not buy a new car. Everything requires some sort of diagnostic tool to be used when changing a part. That diagnostic tool is expensive and only dealers and mechanics have the ability to purchase the tool, license, and/or subscription. Even aftermarket software
@financedystop Love how he puts that thing on the rotor to somehow show he needs it to fix a brake pad.

@financedystop It's customary that the owner of the shop buys the higher end diagnostic equipment so it can be utilized by all of the technicians working on the shop floor.

Because it increases productivity for the whole shop.

@financedystop Government contractors have to pay Boeing, Lockheed, and other huge defense contractors, who taxpayers fund, hundreds of thousands a year for access to repair manuals to fix government planes. Sadly, I think he‚Äôs being honest.
@financedystop If you require a scanner like that to do brakes, you're not a very good mechanic.

@financedystop Yeah, it‚Äôs thousands of dollars per make of car he services to have all the software required to replace certain components. I‚Äôve run into it several times trying to replace things on my own.

@financedystop I‚Äôve contemplated a new RS7, but also begun considering an older car with less computers. 

I have the year prior to all the haptic touchscreens. Any suggestions?

@financedystop Diagnostic tool subscriptions have been around for a number of years. Referencing the infamous SnapOn MT 2400. Any mechanic (or fleet) that had one, had to purchase new M/Y modules or be left in the dust or send vehicle to dealership and pay their diag fee's.
@financedystop Your friends aren't the problem. You are. You probably don't know how to make a decent profit from all your expenses. Blaming your friends for your loss is a cheap excuse

@financedystop My latest purchase has so many computers in it I may as well buy a Cybertruck; and yes, diagnostic computers cost a fortune, and often outrageous subscription fees.

The newer the car he's capable of repairing, the more it costs him to do so.

@financedystop You can‚Äôt measure break pads on a BMW?
@financedystop It‚Äôs easy to forget the overhead costs that professionals face. Those tools and fees are a necessary part of providing quality service.

@financedystop This guy is not a professional mechanic This man is a scammer. 

You don't need a diagnostic done to fill up a tire change your oil change your brake pads or do basic maintenance shit. 

Diagnostics are when you start dealing with major damage or engine malfunctions.

@financedystop That scanner isn‚Äôt anywhere near $10K. Updates are like $1K per year if you must.

Snap on ones are way more and not worth it, just saying. But this one isn‚Äôt $10K lol. Still, the same point remains.

@financedystop Maybe stop living above your means to look like the next person
@financedystop It‚Äôs a hustle
@financedystop The era of Open-Source tools is ready to be born. The greedy corporations have created fertile market conditions.
@financedystop Is that a BMW?  If you own a BMW and you're asking your mechanic why they charge so much, then the problem is you.
@financedystop No one sais your expensive until they compare prices and see someone doing the same thing for less

@financedystop I hate mechanics that try and do this shit. If I bring my car in for a breaks job, change the fucking breaks. Don‚Äôt try and run a diagnostics to see what else you can make money off of.
@financedystop 99% of all non- government businesses are giving you an honest price.

@financedystop Remember when people could do things without computers?

@financedystop This is how manufacturers skirt 'right to repair' laws. You see, you're technically allowed to fix your own car.... After you pay for the software that allows you to fix you car. So a VERY shitty tablet is coded with proprietary software that all costs 1000x it's value. THIEVES

Old neighbor brake service: I need a couple of tools, just get the brakes call me and I‚Äôll teach you son 

Me: What do I owe ya? https://t.co/ex5TkR3hYH
@financedystop For the uninitiated, this is BS. I use a $400 diagnostic tool as a BMW mechanic that has 90% of the functions required. The rest you would take to BMW dealer or use ISTA.

@financedystop The industry is, in fact, messed up.

But the real problem,  in this instance, is your ‚Äúfriends‚Äù.

@financedystop You‚Äôre not supposed to exploit your mechanic friends.. supposed to use them to answer questions and make sure you‚Äôre not getting the shakedown at other spots. Then pay full price at their spot.
@financedystop Maybe know how to fix the car üòÜ

@financedystop I just bought a $275 Innova one 3 weeks ago at AutoZone with no subscription. You don't need the $10k one, tons of models are $9k less or more.

@financedystop My dad always checked, elderly people‚Äôs cars for free. He had the same customers/ families come to his shop for 40 years. Never even put an add space. All word of mouth. He got fucked over by a lot of people because he was too nice.

@financedystop Temu ! Get one for ¬£99

@financedystop Haha, dude deserves his own hell if he paid ‚Äú$10,000‚Äù for any Autel scanner‚Ä¶ and some more hell if he‚Äôs paying ‚Äú$2,500/year‚Äù for the subscription. No credibility.

@financedystop Think thats the issue with any profession, fixed my friends wife website that she fucked up, took me 10 minutes. she said since it was quick , she shouldnt have to pay me 50 bucks. fuck thousands of dollars and hours for schooling and studying, to her i was scamming her

@financedystop STFU man

@financedystop You telling me there isn‚Äôt open source code that can do this?

@financedystop $500 on Alibaba from China with no subscriptions. Until American companies stop charging subscriptions on top of hardware to keep you paying for nothing, I‚Äôll keep buying from China‚Ä¶ China doesn‚Äôt do that perpetual-dipping subscription garbage‚Ä¶ I‚Äôd rather buy American, don‚Äôt
@financedystop So, he only needs 10 costumers to break even. The rest are pure profit.
@financedystop Except that‚Äôs 2k snap on is 10k he‚Äôs already full of üí© take it to real mechanic
@financedystop This is stupid ... you don't need a scanner to figure out 99% of the main problems .. you get a scanner to dig for problems ..

@financedystop Cost of operating a business. 10k depreciated over years is nothing. And subscriptions are another clear operating expense broken down less than $200/months. Businesses that complain about their operating costs are the worst

@financedystop Modern cars: Where changing brakes requires a $10k scanner subscription just to reset the parking brake üò© Mechanics aren't overcharging, manufacturers are gatekeeping repairs! üöóüí∏
@financedystop True üëç 100% I agree you absolutely right

@financedystop Bro, you get free diagnostic from any auto place. Auto-Zone, O'Reilly's etc.

@financedystop 30+ years of this bullshit. I feel your pain brother. Manufacturers hate us independent guys. They do this intentionally in an effort to make it so expensive to work on cars we‚Äôll go broke trying to keep up. Not to mention unnecessary complexity and throw away designs.

@financedystop A professional mechanic doesn't need computers to diagnose the problem.   This whats wrong with America.  We have become too stupid to shit ourselves.

@financedystop There‚Äôs lots of people I blame for the bureaucratic state that infrastructure, construction, and equipment repair & maintenance all fond themselves under. From international standardizations to local unions; hundreds of thousands of litigatory-minded asshats making this mess.

If you‚Äôre using Google @antigravity on macOS, you are likely running it in slow motion without realizing it.

It seems to default to CPU rendering on some Macs.

Run this in your terminal to force-enable GPU rasterization and actually unlock the IDE's full speed:

open -a
